dt: {bc}any of various trees and shrubs (genus {it}Prunus{/it}) of the rose family with globular to oval smooth-skinned edible fruits that are drupes with oblong seeds

{bc}something desirable given in return for a favor

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}plūme{/it}, modification of Latin {it}prunum{/it} plum, from Greek {it}proumnon{/it}
shortdef: any of various trees and shrubs (genus Prunus) of the rose family with globular to oval smooth-skinned edible fruits that are drupes with oblong seeds; also : the fruit
any of various trees with edible fruits resembling plums; also : the fruit
a raisin when used in desserts

dt: {bc}a rich boiled or steamed pudding containing fruits and spices

shortdef: a rich boiled or steamed pudding containing fruits and spices

dt: {bc}a shrubby plum ({it}Prunus maritima{/it}) having white flowers and growing chiefly along the northeastern coast of North America
{bc}its edible usually dark purple fruit that is used especially in preserves

shortdef: a shrubby plum (Prunus maritima) having white flowers and growing chiefly along the northeastern coast of North America; also : its edible usually dark purple fruit that is used especially in preserves

dt: {bc}a small plum tree ({it}Prunus salicina{/it}) native to China and cultivated especially in Japan for its large sweet usually yellow to light red fruit

shortdef: a small plum tree (Prunus salicina) native to China and cultivated especially in Japan for its large sweet usually yellow to light red fruit; also : its fruit
